intro: Planchonella keyensis, commonly known as Key island native lime, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and elliptical leaves with a glossy upper surface. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by round, greenish fruits that turn orange when mature. It is often found in coastal and lowland rainforest habitats, where it thrives in humid, well-drained soils.
